description.narrative: The project is expected to have a number of development impacts including the following: (i) improve access to mobile network in rural areas due to a decreased time to market and improved economics of accessing more sparsely populated areas; (ii) enhance the coverage and quality of service in rural areas; (iii) facilitate more economically efficient use of resources, including land and capital investments, due to the reduced need in the number of towers; (iv) reduce the visual burden of multiple towers as well as the carbon footprint (through reduced and/or more efficient use of diesel generators to supply power in rural locations); (v) encourage more competition that, together with lower capital costs and operating expenses of operators, would translate into the lower cost of services to users, and (vi) assist in the creation of direct and indirect (through subcontracting) employment opportunities.

The project is to support the development of Russian Towers (the Company), an emerging independent tower operator in Russia, which is building a nationwide network of telecommunication towers to lease the tower space to Russian mobile phone operators. The privately-owned Company was established in 2009 and is in an earlier stage of development, currently operating about 140 towers. As an independent tower operator, the Company would allow multiple mobile operators to share tower space, creating significant economic and other benefits.
